info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mecklenburg County through 915 PM EDT... At 836 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virgilina, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buffalo Springs around 845 PM EDT. Clarksville around 850 PM EDT. Boydton around 905 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Nelson, John H Kerr Dam, North View, Finchley, Skipwith, Rogers Corner, Richardson, Keats, Buffalo Junction and Eppes Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central Virginia.
